pages.title: Summary

sections.title: Overview
details: Business Analysis is a research discipline that focuses on identifying business needs and determining solutions to business problems.
Solutions include software development, process improvements, organizational change, or strategic planning.

sections.title: Importance in Modern Organizations
details: Business Analysis plays a critical role in aligning IT solutions with business goals.
Helps organizations maximize ROI and avoid costly project failures.

sections.title: Role of a Business Analyst (BA)
details: BAs serve as a bridge between stakeholders and solution teams.
Responsibilities include gathering and analyzing requirements, feasibility studies, defining scope, validating solutions, and supporting implementation.
Key skills: strong communication, analytical, and problem-solving.

sections.title: Key Stakeholders
details: Internal stakeholders (employees, management)
External stakeholders (customers, regulators, vendors)
Project managers, software developers, QA teams

sections.title: Enterprise Analysis
details: Understands the organization's strategic goals and identifies business needs.

sections.title: Requirements Planning and Management
details: Plans how to gather, document, and manage requirements.

sections.title: Requirements Elicitation
details: Involves interviews, surveys, and workshops to uncover requirements.

sections.title: Requirements Analysis and Documentation
details: Organizes and documents requirements using models and diagrams.

sections.title: Solution Assessment and Validation
details: Ensures the solution meets business needs through validation and testing.

pages.title: Benefits of Business Analysis
details: Improved project success rate
Better stakeholder engagement
Higher quality solutions
Cost and time efficiency

pages.title: Conclusion
details: Business Analysis is essential for effective decision-making, minimizing risks, and delivering value to stakeholders.
